cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 140 (Tuesday, September 10, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FALLON:H.R. 9520.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To require the National Cyber Director to submit toCongress a plan to establish an institute within the FederalGovernment to serve as a centralized resource and trainingcenter for Federal cyber workforce development.[Page H5157]

item.title: Federal Cyber Workforce Training Act of 2024

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 551.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.title: Federal Cyber Workforce Training Act of 2024

item.title: Federal Cyber Workforce Training Act of 2024
Federal Cyber Workforce Training Act of 2024

To require the National Cyber Director to submit to Congress a plan to establish an institute within the Federal Government to serve as a centralized resource and training center for Federal cyber workforce development.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
